channel.title: The challenge of aging
channel.description:
Part of a WUOM series on human behavior, this series seeks to explore the challenges facing the aged.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Why is aging a challenge?
item.description: This program features an interview with Edward Bortz, MD, Lankenau Hospital, Philadelphia.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors

item.title: Some Swedish experiences with aging
item.description: This program features an interview with Ali M. Berggren, Ph.D., Royal Board of Social Welfare, Stockholm, Sweden.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors

item.title: Changing attitudes toward aging
item.description: This program features an interview with Leo W. Simmons, Ph.D., Columbia University, New York City.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors

item.title: Research on aging
item.description: This program features an interview with Nathan Shock, Ph.D., Baltimore City Hospital.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors

item.title: Living arrangements for the aged
item.description: This program features interviews with Mary Cleverly, Federal Housing Administration; Norman Mason, U.S. Housing and Home Finance Agency; George Beauchamp, Ph.D., Kissimmee, Florida; and William Fitch, American Association of Retired Persons.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors

item.title: Emotional health and aging
item.description: This program features interviews with Jack Weinberg, MD, University of Illinois, Chicago; Matthew Ross, MD, American Psychiatric Association, Washington D.C.; and Louis Cohen, MD, Duke University Medical Center.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors

item.title: Physiology and aging
item.description: This program features an interview with Steven Horvath, MD, Lankenau Hospital, Philadelphia.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors

item.title: A psychologist looks at aging
item.description: This program features an interview with Irving Lorge, Ph.D., Columbia University, New York City.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors

item.title: Meeting the challenge of aging
item.description: This program features an interview with A.L. Chapman, MD, Assistant Surgeon General, U.S. Public Health Service, Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Glen
item.dc:subject: Well-being--Age factors
